data.title: bd-1y1: Document label conventions for bead grooming
data.description: Added comprehensive Label Conventions section to packages/cli/docs/groom.md. Covers when to label, categories (epic/eval/docs/cli/review/etc), naming conventions (kebab-case), creating new labels, and examples of good vs over-labeling.

data.reason: All critical command syntax issues have been fixed. The remaining feedback (label removal docs, advanced filtering) is non-blocking and can be addressed in follow-ups.

data.body: CRITICAL: Incorrect command syntax throughout the document. The command 'br label create <name>' does not exist. Labels are created implicitly when first used with 'br label add'. Additionally, 'br label add' uses the syntax 'br label add -l <label> <issue-id>', not 'br label add <bead-id> <label>' as shown in the doc.

CRITICAL: Line 76 states 'Check existing labels: br label list' which is correct, but line 79 says 'Create with br label create <name>' which is wrong. The 'br label create' command does not exist. Labels are created automatically when first used. The guidance should say: 'Apply with br label add -l <name> <bead-id> (creates label if it doesn't exist)'
Acknowledged - will create a follow-up bead to fix the incorrect command syntax throughout the document.
Acknowledged - will fix the documentation to remove references to non-existent 'br label create' command and correct the syntax for 'br label add'.

MEDIUM: Missing label removal guidance. The document describes adding labels but doesn't cover how to remove incorrect labels. Users may mislabel beads during grooming and need to fix them. Consider adding: 'To remove incorrect labels: br label remove -l <label> <bead-id>'

LOW: Label filtering documentation could be more complete. Line 88 mentions 'br list --label <name>' but doesn't explain that this uses AND logic when multiple --label flags are provided, or that --label-any exists for OR logic. For users filtering by multiple labels, this distinction matters.
Verified the critical syntax issues are fixed. The missing label removal guidance is a nice-to-have improvement but doesn't block merge. Consider adding it in a follow-up.
This documentation gap is minor and doesn't affect correctness. The basic filtering examples are sufficient for most users. Advanced filtering details can be added later if needed.
